CE&S is responsible for all up services across the company, including consulting, customer success, and support across Microsoft’s portfolio of solutions and products. Join CE&S and help us accelerate AI transformation for our customers and the world.
   

  

 As a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) specialized in AI, Apps, and Dev you will get to help customers build secure, scalable, and AI-ready solutions on Microsoft Azure as well as inspire and skill them on the latest Azure services and development practices. In this customer-facing role, you’ll deliver engagements that span architecture design, production deployments and operational development ensuring performance, resiliency, and security across mission-critical workloads and use cases. You will leverage existing Repeatable IPs, execution engines, and your expert guidance to accelerate customer satisfaction and adoption focusing on services like AI Foundry, AI Cognitive Services, Azure Open AI, App Services, ACA/AKS, APIM, Azure Integration Services, Cosmos DB, and Github. You’ll collaborate with local colleagues and global engineering teams, sharing best practices and staying current with evolving trends to help customers unlock the full value of their Cloud and AI investments.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Engage with customer IT/business leaders and technical specialists to understand their data estate, priorities, and success measures, and design secure, scalable AI and App solutions that deliver measurable business value.
* Lead architecture design sessions, develop AI and App roadmaps, and drive technical- and organizational development for customers to accelerate adoption and ensure long-term technical viability.
* Own the end-to-end technical delivery results, ensuring completeness and accuracy of consumption and customer success plans in collaboration with colleagues.
* Drive next best actions and generate incremental pipeline from each engagement, aligning with Customer and Microsoft values.
* Drive technical excellence by leading the health-, resiliency, security, and optimization of mission-critical data workloads, ensuring readiness for production-scale AI and App platforms and agentic use cases.
* Identify and resolve technical blockers, share customer feedback with engineering teams, and influence product improvements through Voice of the Customer insights.
* Deliver- and contribute to repeatable intellectual property (IP) to achieve targeted customer outcomes and to accelerate Azure consumption.
* Provide delivery oversight and escalation support for key Factory engagements across AI, App, and Dev workloads.
* Maintain deep technical expertise and stay current with market trends, competitive insights, and Microsoft’s evolving AI, App, and Dev capabilities.
* Be accredited and certified to deliver with advanced and expert-level proficiency in priority workloads including Microsoft Foundry, Azure AI Cognitive Services, Azure Open AI, App Services, ACA, APIM, Azure Integration Services, Cosmos DB, and Github.
* Demonstrate a growth mindset by continuously aligning your skills to team and customer needs, contributing to technical communities, and mentoring others to accelerate customer outcomes.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications (RQs)** 
  

  

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR equivalent experience

* Good general knowledge in
+ Cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP)
+ Artificial Intelligence (Generative AI/Machine Learning)
+ Applications (Frontend/Backend/Integration)
+ Databases (SQL/NOSQL)

* Proficiency in programming e.g. Python, .NET or Java
* Fluent in both Swedish and English - spoken and written
* Currently based in Sweden


**Preferred Qualifications (PQs)**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR equivalent experience

* Experience of a customer-facing role (internal or external)
* Expertise in
+ Modern full stack App architecture design and cloud native development (e.g., APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven)


 or
   

  

* 
+ Expertise in Gen AI & ML models and technologies (e.g., Agentic AI frameworks, AI Platforms, AI SDKs, Responsible AI, Fine-tuning/Inferencing, etc.)

* Expertise in relevant Azure services (e.g. Azure Machine Learning, Microsoft Foundry, Microsoft Agent Framework, Azure Open AI, Azure AI Cognitive Services, App Services, Azure Container Apps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure API Management, Github, Azure Devops)


 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: Operativ IT-support med Monitor erfarenhet, Solna
description:
**Drivs du av IT och service? W5 Sweden i Solna söker dig som vill kombinera IT-support med kontorsansvar i ett växande bolag.**
 Har du erfarenhet av Monitor och vill arbeta brett med teknisk support och kontorsservice i en dynamisk miljö? Som operativ IT-support hos W5 Sweden i Solna får du en nyckelroll i en organisation där affärssystemet är centralt för det dagliga arbetet. Du stöttar användare i Monitor G5, erbjuder support i vardagens IT-frågor och ser till att datorer, mötesrumsteknik och informationsskärmar fungerar som de ska. Du blir en del av ett växande företag där arbetssätt och processer formas efter behov. På kontoret i Solna möts du av en prestigelös kultur, stort engagemang och viljan att bidra varje dag. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Ditt anställningserbjudande**
 Tjänsten erbjuder ett varierat uppdrag i en miljö där teknik möter service. Det är en operativ och självständig roll där du blir ett viktigt stöd för en organisation i förändring, där nya behov och metoder växer fram successivt. Rollen passar dig som har god förståelse för affärssystemet Monitor och teknisk support, och som trivs med att hjälpa kollegor i deras dagliga arbete. Du blir en närvarande funktion på kontoret som bistår praktiskt och bidrar till att rutiner och arbetssätt formas och förfinas över tid. Kulturen präglas av engagemang, professionalism och arbetsglädje.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 En varierad och operativ roll där du ansvarar för IT-support och kontorsservice i det löpande arbetet:
   

  

* Stötta användare i affärssystemet Monitor G5, inklusive administration av behörigheter, hantering av åtkomster och enklare inköp.
* Hjälpa kollegor i IT-relaterade frågor kopplat till Teams, Outlook, SharePoint och andra verktyg.
* Bistå vid utbyte och uppdatering av datorer och telefoner samt bistå med appar, e-post och tekniska inställningar.
* Fungera som kontaktperson mellan kontoret i Solna, den centrala IT-funktionen och företagets IT-leverantör.
* Ansvara för mötesrumsteknik, informationsskärmar och enklare felsökning av teknisk utrustning.
* Utföra praktiska uppgifter relaterade till larm, passersystem och fastighetsnära ärenden.


**Värt att veta**
 Rollen utgår från kontoret i Solna och fungerar som en viktig länk mellan siten och huvudkontoret. Du rapporterar till People & Culture Manager och ingår i ett team på cirka 50 medarbetare.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Start enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Våra förväntningar**
 Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av teknisk support i en verksamhetsnära roll. Du har god vana att arbeta i Windowsmiljö och med Office 365, inklusive felsökning, stöttning vid uppstart och utbyte av datorer och mobila enheter. Du har goda kunskaper i Monitor G5 och förstår systemets uppbyggnad, ett krav för att kunna stötta andra effektivt. Du har minst gymnasial utbildning inom IT eller teknik eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet och uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
   

  

 Som person är du serviceinriktad, pedagogisk och lyhörd. Du tar ansvar, är lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du arbetar självständigt men är en naturlig del av teamet. Du har lätt för att ta initiativ, kommunicerar tydligt och inger förtroende i kontakt med användare på olika nivåer. För att trivas i rollen behöver du gilla att vara på plats, trivas med sociala kontakter och vilja bidra aktivt.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Rekryteringen sker i samarbete med TNG, specialister på kompetensbaserad och fördomsfri rekrytering, bemanning och interim. Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan med CV eller LinkedIn-profil, och utan personligt brev, i vårt enkla ansökningsformulär. Notera att vi inte kan ta emot ansökningar via e-post, men att du alltid är välkommen att maila rekryteraren vid frågor. Efter inskickad ansökan kommer vi dels anonymisera dina personuppgifter, dels bjuda in till en intervju med vår AI-avatar Tengai, innan vi gör en första bedömning. Givetvis får du mer information om varje steg när det är dags och så snart du skickat in din ansökan kan du följa den i realtid via vår hemsida. Observera att vi gör urval löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum. Varmt välkommen!

title: Enterprise Architect – SAP/Finance Domain
description:
****Job Description****
 At H&M, we are on an exciting journey to modernize our core ERP landscape by t
 **ransitioning to SAP S/4HANA** 
 as part of our global business transformation. This is not just a technology upgrade—it is a unique opportunity to simplify processes, enable innovation, and shape the future of fashion retail.
   

  

 We are now looking for an
 **Enterprise Architect – SAP/Finance Domain** 
 to take a leading role in this transformation. In this position, you will be responsible for defining, designing, and governing the architecture of SAP Finance solutions across our global enterprise landscape. You will ensure that business needs are translated into reliable, scalable, and future-ready solutions—fully aligned with enterprise architecture principles and industry best practices.
   

  

 As a key player in our transformation journey, you will help shape the future ERP landscape and guide H&M through one of the most strategic shifts in our history.
   

  

****WHAT YOU’LL DO****
 As Enterprise Architect within the Finance Domain, you will:
   

  

* Define and maintain the target architecture for SAP Finance, including integration with SAP and non-SAP systems.
* Partner with business stakeholders to translate financial processes, compliance needs, and strategic goals into scalable IT solutions.
* Drive solution design for projects and change initiatives, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture, security, and data governance.
* Own the target architecture for H&M’s SAP S/4HANA journey (public, private, and hybrid cloud models).
* Translate business goals—such as speed, sustainability, and customer experience—into future-proof IT landscapes.
* Guide decisions on Greenfield, Brownfield, or hybrid migration approaches.
* Ensure integration with H&M’s broader digital ecosystem (e-commerce, PLM, POS, logistics, sustainability).
* Lead architecture governance, standards, and roadmaps across the transformation program.
* Collaborate with SAP, system integrators, and technology partners to maximize ecosystem value.
* Act as a bridge between business and IT, ensuring technology investments deliver measurable business outcomes.


****WHAT YOU’LL DO****
 As Enterprise Architect within the Finance Domain, you will:
   

  

* Define and maintain the target architecture for SAP Finance, including integration with SAP and non-SAP systems.
* Partner with business stakeholders to translate financial processes, compliance needs, and strategic goals into scalable IT solutions.
* Drive solution design for projects and change initiatives, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture, security, and data governance.
* Own the target architecture for H&M’s SAP S/4HANA journey (public, private, and hybrid cloud models).
* Translate business goals—such as speed, sustainability, and customer experience—into future-proof IT landscapes.
* Guide decisions on Greenfield, Brownfield, or hybrid migration approaches.
* Ensure integration with H&M’s broader digital ecosystem (e-commerce, PLM, POS, logistics, sustainability).
* Lead architecture governance, standards, and roadmaps across the transformation program.
* Collaborate with SAP, system integrators, and technology partners to maximize ecosystem value.
* Act as a bridge between business and IT, ensuring technology investments deliver measurable business outcomes.


****WHO YOU ARE****
 You are an experienced Enterprise Architect who thrives at the intersection of
 **business transformation and technology strategy** 
 . You combine deep SAP expertise with a holistic view of enterprise architecture.
   

  

****Must-Have Skills & Experience****
* Proven experience working as an Enterprise Architect within the Finance domain, with a deep understanding of financial processes, systems, and regulatory landscapes.
* Proven track record in SAP ERP transformations (preferably S/4HANA migrations).
* Deep understanding of S/4HANA architecture, deployment models, and integration patterns.
* Experience with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and modern integration technologies (SAP CPI, APIs, event-driven architectures).
* Strong grounding in enterprise architecture frameworks (TOGAF, ArchiMate or similar).
* Solid knowledge of data strategy, master data governance, and analytics on SAP HANA.
* Experience in large-scale, complex retail or fashion industry environments is a strong plus.


****Soft Skills****
* Strategic mindset with ability to link technology to business outcomes.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills at executive and operational levels.
* Strong leadership in change management and cross-functional collaboration.
* Comfortable operating in a global, fast-paced, and diverse environment.


**Apply now** 
 to help shape the future of H&M’s digital backbone and play a key role in our journey to S/4HANA.
   

  

****Additional Information****
 This is a full-time position with a placement in Stockholm!
   

  

****WHO WE ARE****
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 In an increasingly connected world, the pandemic has highlighted just how essential telecom networks are to keeping society running. The Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution in connectivity, pushing boundaries to deliver more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.
   

  

 Join the Optical Networks division, where innovation meets scale in the AI driven datacenter era. With the recent acquisition of Infinera, we’ve united two industry leaders to create an optical networking powerhouse - combining cutting-edge technology with proven leadership to redefine the future of connectivity.
   

  

 Infinera is now part of the Nokia Corporation and its subsidiaries. When you apply, the information you share will be handled with care and used only for recruitment purposes within the group.
   

  

 As a
 **Software Development Engineer** 
 at Nokia, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining high quality software for next generation optical communication systems. You will work closely with a global team of developers, architects, and product managers to define requirements, create robust software solutions, and deliver high-performance features that meet the needs of our customers. In our dynamic Agile environment, you’ll collaborate daily with passionate colleagues who are driving innovation across the optical networking domain.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn**
* Design, develop, and implement software components and features for optical networking products using C/C++, Python and/or other programming languages as required.
* Using AI-tools in your daily Software Development work
* Collaborate closely with cross functional development teams during backlog refinement, sprint planning, and feature design discussions to ensure technical alignment.
* Write clean, maintainable, and well documented code while following best practices for software development.
* Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize software to improve performance, reliability, and scalability.
* Contribute to continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines and automation frameworks to enhance development efficiency.
* Use version control systems such as Git to manage code changes and support collaborative development workflows.
* Stay up to date with advancements in optical communication technologies and apply this knowledge to improve software design and system performance.


**Key Skills And Experience**
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in software development, preferably using C/C++, Python or other programming languages.
* Experience in using AI-tools for Software Development
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Solid knowledge of Agile methodologies and experience working in Scrum development teams.
* Strong problem-solving capabilities and effective communication skills for collaboration across global teams.


**It would be nice if you also had:**
* Understanding of optical communication technologies and standards for the same as CMIS, C-CMIS, OTN, Ethernet.
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and build automation tools.
* Software development or Agile related certifications.


**About Us**
**Advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.**
 Nokia is a global leader in connectivity for the AI era. With expertise across fixed, mobile and transport networks, powered by the innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, we’re advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.
   

  

 Learn more about life at Nokia .
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Our employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
   

  

 If you’re interested in this role but don’t meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences enrich our teams, and you may be just the right candidate for this or another opportunity.
   

  

 The length of the recruitment process may vary depending on the specific role's requirements. We strive to ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates. Discover more about the recruitment process at Nokia .

title: Microsoft 365 Purview och Defender-specialist till Sveriges Radio
description:
Företagsbeskrivning gömd på alla jobb på hela kontot. Kontakta Jobylon för att visa igen.
   

  

*Sveriges Radios uppdrag är att sända radio i allmänhetens tjänst och vi har 7,4 miljoner lyssnare i veckan. Över hälften av befolkningen tar del av vårt utbud i någon form varje dag. Antingen i direktsänd linjär radio eller on-demand, i FM, på våra egna digitala plattformar eller hos andra aktörer. Vi erbjuder trovärdig kunskap, fördjupning, sällskap och förströelse. Att jobba på Sveriges Radio innebär därför att du, oavsett roll, är en värdefull del i ett viktigt uppdrag.*
 Sveriges Radio är en utpräglad tech-organisation. När du lyssnar på oss är det 100 års konstant teknikutveckling från en arena i teknologins framkant du hör. Bakom varje program och sändning, i varenda kanal och plattform, finns ett kraftfullt fundament av innovativ teknologi. Som verkar tyst i bakgrunden, dygnet runt, året om, med oerhörda krav på precision, stabilitet och säkerhet. Är man en del av totalförsvaret så är man. Och kraven på oss framåt är om möjligt ännu högre. Vi är idag över 300 IT-experter som ser till att ge röst åt fler röster och starkare berättelser för en större förståelse. Och de utmaningar vi har framför oss har inget utrymme för misslyckanden. Så vill man vara med och göra skillnad, på riktigt, ja då ska man jobba med tech på Sveriges Radio.
   

  

**Nu söker Sveriges Radio dig som brinner för ny teknik och Microsoft 365 för en spännande tjänst inom digital arbetsplats med fokus på säkerhet. Hos oss får du ett omväxlande arbete där du är med och påverkar utvecklingen av våra tekniska lösningar och är en viktig del på vår resa till AI-förstärkta digitala arbetsplatser.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Du Kommer Att Ansvara För Design, Implementation Och Underhåll Av Vår M365-infrastruktur Med Fokus På Data- Och Informationssäkerhet. Du Kommer Att Samarbeta Med Våra Avdelningar För Cybersäkerhet Och Informationssäkerhet Och Få Vara Med Och Utveckla Processer Samt Införa Ny Teknik Som Gör Att Vi Kan Fortsätta Ligga i Framkant Och, Tillsammans Med Resten Av Organisationen, Göra Radio i Världsklass. Vidare Kommer Du Att
   

  

* Leda design, implementering och administration av M365-lösningar med fokus på Microsoft Purview och Defender.
* Säkerställa att riskbedömningar, behovsanalyser och regelverk överensstämmer med skyddet i M365.
* Tillhandahålla expertkunskap vid konfigurering och administration av M365 med särskilt fokus på Microsoft Purview och Defender.
* Stödja teamet inom frågor som rör daglig administration och underhåll av M365-miljön.
* Fungera som eskaleringspunkt för M365-frågor, erbjuda snabb hjälp och proaktiv problemlösning.
* Arbeta nära andra team inom både IT och verksamheten för att förstå deras krav och medverka till effektiva samarbeten.
* Dela med sig av kunskap och nyvunna erfarenheter till olika intressentgrupper.


**Om teamet**
 Din roll ingår i Team Samarbetsplattform som är ett tvärfunktionellt team som bestående av specialister inom digitala samarbetsverktyg och automation i Microsoft 365. Vi värdesätter lärande, innovation och samarbete – här utvecklas du tillsammans med andra nyfikna kolleger och delar kunskap i takt med att nya tekniker introduceras. Team Samarbetsplattform finns inom avdelningen IT-arbetsplats som är en del av IT-enheten på Sveriges radio.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du tycker det är roligt att både hänga med i teknikutvecklingen, dela med dig av din kunskap och växa i din roll. Du är en prestigelös och ansvarstagande lagspelare som alltid möter dina kollegor med en hjälpande hand och en lösningsfokuserad inställning. Vi tror också att du är lyhörd samt förstår verksamhetens behov. Att samarbeta mellan olika team och avdelningar är avgörande, och vi upplever dig som någon som vågar ta initiativ för att driva arbetet framåt och hitta lösningar.
   

  

**Utöver Ovan Har Du**
* Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, cybersäkerhet, informationsteknik eller relaterat område, eller liknande kunskaper inhämtade på annat sätt.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att administrera Microsoft 365, Microsoft Purview och/eller Defender, eller liknande roll.
* Kunskap om samt viljan att lära dig mer om: Microsoft Purview, så som Information Protection, Data Loss Prevention, DSPM, mm.
* Microsoft Defender for O365 och Defender for Cloud Apps.
* Förståelse för att upprätthålla, riskbedöma och/eller kravställa en säker M365-miljö.
* Problemlösnings- och felsökningsförmågor i IT-miljöer.
* Grundläggande språkkunskaper i svenska, tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Exchange Online, Exchange Hybrid eller Exchange On-prem.
* Säker mejlhantering och mejlmigreringar.
* Starka verbala och skriftliga kommunikationsfärdigheter.
* Microsoft-certifieringar, som SC-900, SC-300, SC-400, MS-100, MS-101, MS-500, AZ-104 eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av IT-relaterade utredningar, revisioner, regelefterlevnad, incidenthantering eller liknande.
* Power Platform, Power Automate, Azure Runbooks, Azure Logic Apps eller Azure Functions.
* Kännedom om tredjepartsverktyg och lösningar som kompletterar M365.


**Anställning och ansökan**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning. Större delen av teamet arbetar i Radiohuset i Stockholm, men vi har också medarbetare på olika lokala kontor runt om i Sverige. Därför välkomnar vi sökanden från hela landet. Vi tillämpar hybridarbete några dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag är 8 februari 2026** 
 , men vänta inte med att söka då vi går igenom kandidater löpande.  Vid frågor om tjänsten: Mårten Hellebro, marten.hellebro@sr.se
   

  

*På Sveriges radio samlas medarbetare med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och perspektiv - något som vi ser som en förutsättning för att skapa innehåll och utveckling som är relevant, trovärdigt och tillgängligt för hela samhället.*
*För att bredda våra perspektiv och utvecklas som organisation ser vi varje rekrytering som en chans att växa. Vi välkomnar alla att söka våra tjänster - men vi vill särskilt uppmuntra kvinnor att söka denna roll då vi idag har en överrepresentation av män inom IT-enheten.*
 Sveriges Radio är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och har en viktig roll inom totalförsvaret. Vår verksamhet omfattas bland annat av regler om säkerhetsskydd och på grund av det genomförs en kontroll av kandidaten för många av tjänsterna i vår verksamhet innan anställning sker. För de tjänster som leder till deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet eller placering i säkerhetsklass innebär denna kontroll att säkerhetsprövning genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

title: Sales Associate
description:
**🚀 Join TEKsystems as an Sales Associate / Account Manager** 




 At TEKsystems®, our unmatched success in IT Services and Talent Management is powered by one thing—our people. As the tech industry continues to thrive, we’re growing fast and looking for driven Account Managers to join our high-performing team.
 



 We offer a dynamic environment with unlimited earning potential, clear paths for advancement, and opportunities for both personal and professional growth.
 



  





 💼 The Role
 



 As a Sales person, you’ll become a specialist in your sales territory, responsible for:
 


* Developing and expanding your client base
* Conducting deep discovery and providing strategic insights
* Demonstrating clear differentiation to win new business
* Delivering exceptional service to both new and existing clients



  





 🤝 What You’ll Contribute
 



 Your success will hinge on strong collaboration with our recruiter teams to meet client hiring needs. You’ll:
 


* Win new business and grow existing accounts through insight and strategy
* Partner with internal teams to oversee sourcing, screening, and onboarding
* Deliver outstanding customer service
* Stay ahead of market trends to act as a trusted advisor



  





 🧠 What You Bring
 


* Proven ability to identify and convert new business opportunities
* Strong territory planning and business development skills
* Experience in performance-driven environments
* Passion for networking and communication
* Grit, tenacity, and determination



  





 🎁 What You’ll Get
 


* Competitive base salary
* Uncapped commission
* Annual all-inclusive incentive trips
* Opportunities to give back through charitable initiatives
* Health and well-being support



  





 🌟 What We’re Looking For
 



 We’re seeking ambitious individuals with:
 


* A competitive spirit and strong drive
* A collaborative mindset and team-first attitude
* Commitment, perseverance, and a desire to build a long-term career



  





 🎯 Bonus Points For
 


* Familiarity with Salesforce CRM
* Experience in a B2B sales and commission environment
* Experience in outbound calling and prospecting
* Exposure to sales methodologies like MEDDIC or Business Value Messaging



  





 📈 Career Growth Starts Here
 



 At TEKsystems, your career path is yours to shape. Whether you want to deepen your expertise in sales or lead a high-performing team, we’ll support your journey every step of the way
 



  





**Ready to take the next step in your career? Let’s connect.**

title: Testledare
description:
**TESTLEDARE TILL KONSULTBOLAG I VÄRLDSKLASS!**
**﻿PURE ERBJUDER**
 Hos oss blir du en specialistkonsult i toppskiktet av Din kompetens och vi kan erbjuda dig marknadens mest stimulerande uppdrag, både gällande innehåll, uppdragsgivare och arvode. Du får utrymme att utvecklas inom ditt intresseområde, du styr vilka uppdrag du tar, hur du vill arbeta – och sist men inte minst: hur mycket lön och semester du tar ut. För hos oss erbjuder vi attraktiva ersättningsmodeller och du väljer vad som passar dig bäst. Som konsult hos oss blir du garanterad en högre ersättning för motsvarande arbete på marknaden.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en proffsig organisation i ryggen där man som konsult får stora möjligheter att växa som konsult och att få vara en del av en grym gemenskap. Att vara konsult hos oss ska vara extra kul, så vi erbjuder våra konsulter gemensamma aktiviteter som är i särklass – allt ifrån årliga konferenser på varmare breddgrader till kyligare bergsmassiv i Alperna!
   

  

 Vi vet vad en bra konsult förtjänar… rätt balans mellan arbete och livet – och det är A och O hos oss!
   

  

**DEN VI SÖKER**
 Du har redan många års erfarenhet av Testledning i bagaget, oavsett om det har varit som anställd eller som konsult. Denna erfarenhet har gett dig en stark grund inom traditionell testledning samtidigt som du är redo att möta morgondagens krav och tekniker. Med din gedigna kompetens inom testområdet har du förmågan att skickligt driva testprocesser för våra kunder.
   

  

* 5+ års erfarenhet som Testledare/Teknisk testledare
* Vana att arbeta agilt, gärna certifierad Scrum Master eller inom SAFe
* Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, SoapUI, Postman, Java eller Python.
* Teststrategi/rapportering och Planering
* Erfarenhet av Testautomatisering/Enhetstester
* Du pratar och skriver både svenska och engelska obehindrat
* Ingenjörsexamen eller examen inom systemvetenskap


**OM OSS**
 Pure Consulting Group startades 2010 av erfarna IT-entreprenörer och utvecklare och har sedan dess vuxit organiskt i enlighet med devisen “Kvalitet framför kvantitet”. Vi är idag 70 knivskarpa konsulter i med kontor i Umeå, Stockholm och Helsingborg.
   

  

 Hos oss sätts konsulten i centrum, vi erbjuder de mest tilltalande uppdragen, erbjuder marknadens bästa villkor och ser till att hos oss är det extra kul att vara konsult.
   

  

 Verksamhetsfälten sträcker sig över utveckling och IT-arkitektur, integration, teknisk testning samt projekt- och testledning. Här hjälper vi våra uppdragsgivare att effektivisera mjukvaruleveransen och ”Digitalt transformera kundens verksamhet på riktigt”, för att citera vad ledande bolag på den svenska marknaden sagt om oss.
   

  

 Genom vår tekniska expertis i samspel med branschkunskap inom exempelvis bank och försäkring, offentlig verksamhet och spel hjälper vi våra kunder till effektivare processer och förbättrade användarupplevelser. Och vi är alltid i framkant, vi vet vad som väntar runt hörnet, vilken teknik, verktyg eller process som är det bästa just nu.
   

  

 Det låter kanske lite skrytsamt, men vi vet att vi är ett av de bästa konsultbolagen – för det säger våra konsulter, om och om igen, i återkommande uppföljningar. Och då är det ju så!
   

  

 Välkommen att kontakta oss!

title: Junior Consultant to M&A Analytics within Transaction Services (Stockholm) - Aug 2026
description:
Deloitte is a global leader in Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal and Consultative Services. With more than 470,000 employees in over 150 countries, we help our clients and our communities solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals through domain and industry expertise, global reach and alliances with the largest tech providers. What defines Deloitte is our drive to make a meaningful difference. For us, this means long-term development and results for our clients and their companies, ideas and actions that also contribute to positive societal development. It is also about empowering our people and promoting their development.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 In M&A Transaction Services we help our clients in connection to acquisition or sale of companies. Our work includes financial analysis of historical trading and balance sheets and assessing consistency in forecasts compared to historical trends, order books and other known factors, to get the best possible basis for valuing a business. Our work supports a buyer with relevant knowledge to make a valuation of a business and to understand operational and financial assets and liabilities as well as other risks to be considered in a transaction. Our clients include both domestic and international private equity firms and strategic corporates.
   

  

  





 In our M&A Analytics team within Transaction Services, we are now looking for a Consultant to join our team in Stockholm August 2026.
   

  

  





**The work we do**




 Be a part of the fast-growing area of M&A Analytics, where we use data to drive insights and decisions in both buy- and sell-side transactions. Data analytics within M&A is not just about processing numbers, it is a about creating a “single-source-of-truth” that underpins or validates the equity story in direct collaboration with the broader deal team. Our role is to transform complex data engineering and analytics tasks into simple, compelling narratives, providing strategic insights that have a direct impact on the deal at hand.
   

  

  





**Your Role**




 You will join the specialized M&A Analytics team and contribute to project delivery with continuous support from the team to help you learn and grow in your role. We are close-knit and fast-growing team, and as you develop in your role you will take on greater responsibility in driving our projects forward and improving our offering. You will get the opportunity to improve not only your analytical and problem-solving abilities, but also your understanding of the M&A process and identifying value drivers and risks within a business. Expect to engage in dynamic client projects, each with its own unique business model and data sources which will challenge you to innovate through python programming in our quest to extract strategic insights.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

**About You** 
  

  

  





 You are a recent graduate or have approximately 1–2 years of experience in a data-related field. To succeed in the role, we expect you to have:
   

  

  




* A completed Master's degree or equivalent, preferably in a quantitative field such as Engineering, Data science, Economics, Statistics, Analytics or similar


* Experience (professional or from coursework) in programming or analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL and Power BI. It is especially meritorious if you are familiar with Python packages such as Pandas, Numpy, SciKit and Statsmodel, and the use of DAX measures in Power BI.


* It is a plus, but not a requirement, if you have previous experience or a familiarity with finance and accounting concepts strong quantitative capabilities and a methodical approach to problem solving


* Attention to detail, ensuring thoroughness and accuracy in every aspect of your work


* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team-oriented environment and clearly articulate complex data insights in simple terms to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


* An interest in working in a dynamic M&A environment, combined with curiosity and business awareness to uncover the key drivers behind business performance.


 We are a team consisting of people from a diverse background in terms of education and previous professional experience, and we encourage you to apply even if you feel like you don’t tick all the boxes! If you have a strong interest in the role and a willingness to learn, we welcome you to send in an application.
   

  

  


**How You’ll Grow**




 In our M&A Analytics team, we offer:
   

  

  




* A collaborative team environment that values individual contributions and fosters professional development and recognition


* We offer a supportive environment where your growth and learning are prioritised, providing you with the guidance and opportunities to thrive on a steep learning curve


* The opportunity to be a vital member of a fast-growing team using Python programming and BI tools to identify hidden insights for M&A transactions and value creation


* Diverse project exposure, allowing you to delve into a variety of industries and clients, enhancing your analytical skills and business acumen


* Global interaction and experience through engagements with international colleagues, clients and investors which broadens your professional network and cultural awareness


**Additional Information**

**What we offer**




 As a part of Deloitte you get access to the world’s largest consultancy network, meaning you have colleagues all over the globe who you can utilize in order to develop yourself, our clients and our business. You will work with exciting and complex projects both on a global and Nordic level within a team who values your perspective. Your personal development and the opportunities that help you grow is of great importance to us. We offer you practical experience, a personal coach as well as continuous feedback and input from more experienced colleagues.
   

  

  





 You get the opportunity to be part of an organization where we help our clients on their journey to become a more sustainable organization. You also get to be involved in our own initiatives regarding climate and environmental work as well as social responsibility.
   

  

  





**How to apply**




 Submit your application online as soon as possible. Your application should contain your:
   

  

  




* CV


* University grades. The grade document you upload should have been retrieved no more than 2 months ago


 In the first step, you upload your CV. In the next step, you upload your university transcripts (for courses completed so far) and answer questions related to the role, including a motivation for why you have applied for this role. Please note that you need to submit all the requested documents for your application to be considered completed. Apply as soon as possible as we review applications on an ongoing basis. Upon submitting your application, you should receive a confirmation email from us. If you don't receive this email, we advise you to submit your application again. If you are applying for multiple positions with us, please clarify in your applications which role you are most interested in.
   

  

  


 At Deloitte, we value different skills, perspectives, and experiences, as it enables us to effectively solve complex challenges for our clients. We encourage you to apply for the position if you believe your skills can contribute to our team´s success.
   

  

  





**Questions**




 If you have any questions regarding the application process, please contact Sophie Karlerö Kolijn, Recruiter, at skarlero@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, in order to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/. For the roles where university grades are requested a verification of the grades is made as a part of the recruitment process. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: BI Engineer
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Are you driven by data and have a talent for transforming insights into actionable strategies? We're seeking a talented BI Engineer to join our innovative team. In this role, you'll be instrumental in designing and developing business intelligence solutions that empower our organization to make informed decisions.
   

  

 If you have a passion for data analytics, a knack for problem-solving, and a desire to drive business growth, apply now to be a part of our data-driven journey!
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Utilising Tableau to create compelling visualisations that effectively communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels.
* Ensuring data accuracy, performance, and usability of existing dashboards, implementing improvements as needed.
* Working closely with data engineers to define data requirements, optimise data pipelines, and ensure efficient data delivery.
* Adhering to and promoting data quality standards, ensuring data integrity and security.
* Developing and maintaining robust BI solutions that meet the evolving needs of the business, exploring and integrating new technologies as needed.
* Effectively communicating data-driven insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Working closely with various departments (e.g., marketing, finance, product) to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
* Continuously learning and exploring new technologies and methodologies in the BI landscape, sharing relevant advancements with the team.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* 2-5 years of relevant experience in a similar role and strong academic background.
* Ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders, including non-technical team members and senior management.
* Ability to produce clear and concise documentation, ensuring that technical details were easily understandable by all parties involved.
* Advanced knowledge of SQL, preferably knowledge of Python and Airflow.
* Experience with BI tools.


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience in the iGaming industry.
* Experience working with different database systems .


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 2000 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 19 offices worldwide.
   

  

 BENEFITS:
   

  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

title: Office Coordinator
description:
**Department:** 
 Core - Business Infrastructure & Operations
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  




**Description**
 We are seeking an organised, proactive and detail-oriented Office Coordinator for our Stockholm office. As the sole operations professional on-site, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth day-to-day running of the office, by managing facilities, coordinating suppliers, and providing essential administrative support. Working closely with regional and central teams, you will play a key role in maintaining an efficient and well-functioning workplace.
   

  

 This role is highly visible and critical to our Stockholm team. The ideal candidate is reliable, adaptable, and confident in managing multiple responsibilities independently. The successful candidate will be expected to work on-site a minimum of four days per week. One day per week may be worked remotely, subject to operational needs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Responsible for the day-to-day running of the local office, including ordering office & kitchen supplies, handling all office correspondence, processing supplier invoices and welcoming visitors
* Build and manage relationships with suppliers and service providers, negotiating contracts and ensuring high-quality service delivery
* Manage all facility-related needs, proactively identifying and resolving maintenance issues, including coordinating with third-party service providers
* Support the BIO leadership team in budgeting and financial reporting for office operations, procurement, and local activities
* Act as the central point of contact for all office operations, collaborating with key departments such as People & Culture, Finance, and IT to support office needs
* Provide administrative support as needed, including scheduling meetings, booking travel, handling mail and shipments, and coordinating printing and documentation
* Ensure compliance with operational policies and procedures, educating staff on best practices for expense management, travel bookings, and meeting room usage in coordination with central teams
* Ad hoc support to all areas of the business and the wider Business Infrastructure & Operations team as needed


**What we are looking for**
**Required attributes:** 
* Operational experience including but not limited to areas of HR, finance, legal, and business administration, ideally within a fast-growing international consultancy or professional services business
* Team player with strong interpersonal skills, positive attitude and the ability to build effective relationships at all levels
* Excellent coordination, time management and organisational skills; excellent communication skills (articulate, confident and adaptable to different audiences); strong attention to detail
* A proactive self-starter, comfortable using their initiative and working autonomously, able to identify and resolve issues to support all areas of the business
* Evidence of having a passion for working with people and working beyond the confines of the job description
* Very good knowledge (C1 level) of both Swedish and English is essential
* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office suite


**Desirable attributes:** 
* Advanced Excel knowledge
* Experience of working with an ERP system


**What we offer**
 Some of the benefits we include are:
 * Collective Bargaining Agreement
* Wellness benefits
* Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)


 For more information about our benefits offerings in our Stockholm office, please reach out to us for additional information.
   

  

 At AER, we are committed to offering flexibility in the way we work. Most of our roles are hybrid with a mix of in-office/home working and potentially adjustable working hours. Let’s discuss what works for you and AER during the interview process.
   

  

 The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy, and maternity.
   

  

 To apply, please submit your Résumé / CV, a personal summary, your salary expectations and please inform us of your notice period.

title: Lösningsarkitekt IT-säkerhet
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät ansvarar för att det svenska kraftsystemet är hållbart, säkert och kostnadseffektivt, nu och för framtida generationer. På vår resa mot dessa mål söker vi nu en resurs för att stödja det löpande arbetet med att granska och definiera IT-säkerhetsarkitektur och ingående skyddsåtgärder för befintliga och nya system som ska driftsättas.
   

  

 Som Lösningsarkitekt erbjuds du en komplex, spännande och lärande miljö där det finns möjlighet att utvecklas inom moderna teknologier både inom IT och OT.
   

  

 Du kommer att medverka i planering för utveckling och anpassning av IT-säkerhet i IT-system och infrastrukturlösningar tillsammans med våra utvecklings- och förvaltningsteam, där en del av ditt arbete kommer att bestå i att ta fram och presentera beskrivningar av IT-säkerhetsarkitektur inom olika IT-arkitektforum.
   

  

 I rollen som Lösningsarkitekt ingår du i enheten Styrning IT-säkerhet inom avdelningen IT-säkerhet på Division IT. Enheten ansvarar för att ta fram styrning och vägledning för införande av IT-säkerhet i organisationens IT-system i syfte att utveckla förmågan att möta dagens och morgondagens hot och utmaningar.
   

  

**Förekommande arbetsuppgifter:**
* Ta fram designdokument och lösningsbeskrivningar för IT-säkerhetsarkitektur integrerat i IT-system.
* Säkerställa att de IT-säkerhetslösningar som tas fram är anpassade till Svenska kraftnäts befintliga IT-miljö samt uppfyller verksamhetens behov och
* Stötta vid tekniska vägval – ta fram olika alternativa lösningsförslag samt risk- och konsekvensanalyser.
* Säkerställa kompatibilitet av framtagen IT-säkerhetsarkitektur i förhållande till aktuell målarkitektur och arkitektoniska principer.
* Säkerställa att föreslagna IT-säkerhetslösningar uppfyller gällande lagkrav och föreskrifter för området.
* Kommunicera och dokumentera fastställd IT-säkerhetsarkitektur.
* Medverka i informationsklassning, systemklassning samt risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser samt hotmodellering.


 Din roll är avgörande för att hålla Sveriges elförsörjning stabil och framtidssäkrad. Genom ditt arbete är du med och säkerställer att Sverige varken slocknar eller står still.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav:**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är samarbetsinriktad och har lätt för att bygga relationer och skapa förtroende. Du anpassar din kommunikation efter personer och kompetensnivåer och kan förklara komplexa frågor på ett sätt som skapar förståelse och engagemang. Du tycker om att leverera resultat med hög kvalitet tillsammans med dina kollegor. Du kan se helheter och skapa strukturer som följer övergripande målarkitektur och överenskomna arbetssätt. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är samarbetsinriktad, analytisk, trygg och strukturerad.
   

  

 Vidare har du en relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, teknik eller annan likvärdig utbildning eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som Svenska kraftnät bedömer som likvärdig.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* Minst 5 års aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur för säkerhetslösningar i IT-system.
* Erfarenhet av att utforma och implementera säkerhetslösningar.
* Kunskap om och flerårig erfarenhet av efterlevnad i förhållande till säkerhetsstandarder såsom ISO 27000, CIS Controls och andra ramverk inom cybersäkerhet.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemdesign eller liknande arkitektroller i enlighet med. etablerade metoder, verktyg och processer som t.ex. TOGAF, SABSA.
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.


 Vi ser följande som
 **meriterande** 
 :
   

  

* Certifiering inom IT-arkitektur och säkerhet, t.ex. CISSP el. TOGAF.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetslösningar för integration mellan IT/OT-miljöer.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig verksamhet.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom elförsörjning och/eller kraftöverföring.


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm/Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Resor förekommer i denna tjänst
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 18 februari, vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


**Intresserad av att veta mer?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med Computer Sweden Recruitment. Vid frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult Johanna Nordberg, johanna.nordberg@csrecruitment.se, 070-33 43 159 alternativt Anna Maria Hedman, 010 489 26 71 rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll ST, 010 475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Machine Learning engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Machine Learning Engineer at Viaplay, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the next generation of our data-driven products and services. Working at the intersection of personalization, customer engagement, and operational intelligence, you’ll design and deploy state-of-the-art ML systems that directly impact millions of users across our platform.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will extend far beyond model development. You’ll act as a strategic partner to product, engineering, and commercial teams, translating business objectives into scalable, high-impact ML solutions. Whether enhancing our recommendation engines, uncovering deep user insights, or enabling smarter decision-making across the organization, your work will be central to Viaplay’s continued growth and innovation.
   

  

 You’ll join a high-performing, inclusive, and curious team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Analysts, and Data Engineers. Together, we foster a culture of experimentation, shared ownership, and technical excellence. Our recommender system already powers engaging user experiences, and we’re only at the beginning of our machine learning journey.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models for recommendation, prediction, and classification use cases.
* Own and lead end-to-end ML initiatives, from ideation and stakeholder alignment to development, deployment, and ongoing performance evaluation.
* Translate business needs into structured ML problems and deliver measurable, impactful outcomes.
* Build robust, production-ready pipelines and monitor ML systems in a cloud-native environment.
* Conduct advanced statistical analyses to uncover trends in user behavior, content performance, and platform engagement.
* Collaborate closely with product, engineering, content, commercial, and marketing teams to drive data-informed decision-making.
* Contribute to a culture of experimentation, innovation, and continuous learning within the data team.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We're seeking someone who combines technical depth with strategic thinking and a curious, problem-solving mindset.
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Proven experience leading ML projects end-to-end, from problem definition and stakeholder alignment to deployment and monitoring in production.
* Expertise in one or more ML domains such as LLMs, NLP, recommendation systems, or reinforcement learning.
* Ability to build ML solutions that are scalable, robust, and explainable, not just performant in isolation.
* Strong experience deploying ML models in cloud environments (preferably AWS) and using containerization tools like Docker .
* Familiarity with orchestration tools such as Airflow for reliable ML pipeline execution and monitoring
* Solid software engineering fundamentals.
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in applied Machine Learning within production environments.
* Strong academic background in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with recommender systems, personalization, or content optimization — ideally in media, streaming, or e-commerce.
* Familiarity with MLOps practices, including CI/CD for ML, model monitoring, and production observability.
* Exposure to real-time or near-real-time ML architectures and streaming data systems.


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with at least three days a week in the office, giving you the best mix of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Content Manager
description:
**We are looking for** 




 A Content Manager to join our Global Digital Curation Marketing team. You will be responsible for both the editorial and technical aspects of content across our digital channels, ensuring that the right content is published in the right place at the right time, with high quality and in line with our guidelines. You will work closely with internal stakeholders and technical teams.
 



  





**This is a temporary assignment from February 9 and until May 9.** 




  





**Responsibilities and tasks** 




 You will manage content across our digital channels, ensuring quality and alignment with brand guidelines. The role involves collaborating with stakeholders and technical teams to deliver content effectively and on time.
 


* Ensure that the right content appears at the right time in the right places, including daily work in the CMS (Content Management System) with responsibility to publish content on all platforms (hm.com, e-mail, push notifications, etc.).
* Quality-check and optimize incoming content.
* Ensure that guidelines are followed as soon as the Art Director/Art worker has made a handover of the project.
* Crop and adjust images according to guidelines.
* Review material to find errors and unclear information.
* Own the technical specifications regarding the CMS.
* Work closely with tech resources within the organization to secure the right systems and developments are in place.



  





**Qualifications** 




 We are looking for a candidate with:
 


* 3-5+ years of experience in content creation and brand marketing, ideally within the fashion or lifestyle industry.
* Strong understanding of multi-channel content strategy and execution, including digital, social media, and eCommerce platforms.
* Ability to handle several different stakeholders, ensuring successful collaboration through all touchpoints.
* Previous experience working with various digital marketing channels will be advantageous.
* Excellent administration and communication skills.
* Skilled in managing multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously.
* Experience with content performance analytics tools to assess effectiveness and inform content optimization.
* Strong team players, flexible, straightforward, and open-minded with a positive service-minded mindset
* Able to bring new creative and/or technical ideas and have exceptional fashion expertise.
* Thriving in a high-paced environment and able to quickly change direction and take fast decisions and actions even if information is missing.



  





**About the company** 




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make. We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
 



  





**Other information** 




 This is a temporary assignment from February 9 and until May 9. The role is
 **based on-site at H&M headquarter centrally located office in Stockholm.** 
 We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis to find the right candidate as soon as possible, so please apply today!
 



  





*For WorkStudio it is important to offer equal opportunities. We will therefore consider all qualified applications for employment without any regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.*

title: Projects Administrator
description:
At Westinghouse Electric Company, we are pioneers in nuclear technology and our technology is the basis for nearly half of the world's commercial nuclear power plants in operation. Today, we are also building several new reactors that contribute to more fossil-free energy. Globally, we have over 10,000 employees in 19 countries, of which 1,000 are at our Swedish workplaces in Västerås and Täby. Our Swedish operations were founded in 1969 and supply nuclear fuel as well as products and services in automation, maintenance, testing and decommissioning for customers around the world. Read more about us www.westinghousenuclear.com .
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you highly organized, detail-oriented, and passionate about supporting complex international projects? We are looking for a Projects Administrator to join our team and help ensure a smooth operations across nuclear power projects worldwide.
   

  

 You will report to the President & Operations Manager WesDyne Sweden and be located in Täby, Sweden.
   

  

 Model of work: hybrid.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Access and Entry management: Prepare and maintain access documentation for each country, nuclear facility, and participating resource. Handle deployment notifications for international projects.
* Document and Dose management: Register and manage all received documents and certificates in internal systems, including mail handling. Issue certificates and supporting documentation. Manage radiation dose tracking and registration.
* Trainings administration: Plan and maintain internal and external training programs.
* Health administration: Schedule and book occupational health checks and ensure all required health and fitness certificates are in place.
* Executive and Project support: Provide administrative, strategic, and operational support to the CEO, management team, and project managers, ensuring a smooth business processes.
* Qualifications management: Handle company, supplier, and personnel qualifications. Maintain company profiles in client portals and prepare supporting documentation.
* Security and Protective Security: Act as security contact within the organization, manage visitor access, and ensure compliance with General Data Protection Regulation and export control laws. Plan and conduct security clearances and interviews for on-site personnel, partnering with client security departments and authorities.
* Work Environment coordination: Ensure compliance with Swedish labor laws and company EHS standards. Support internal work environment projects and improvements.


**Qualifications**
* 2+ years of experience as a Projects Administrator in a similar role.
* Fluent in English and Swedish, both written and spoken; additional languages such as German, French, or Spanish are a plus.
* Experience in an international business environment
* Proficiency in internet navigation for information gathering.
* Result orientation
* Not essential, but helpful:
* Experience with SAP and CAD systems.
* Interest in IT technology


**We Offer**
 At Westinghouse, we offer an inspiring work environment in a high-tech industry. You will be a part of a network of global experts from several different areas and we offer great opportunities for competence development and career growth, both in Sweden and abroad. As a member of our team, you will work together with engaged colleagues and be a part of an environment that is both challenging and supportive. Many of our positions are based in activity-based environments which enables a flexible workplace.
   

  

 At Westinghouse, we have a strong safety culture.
   

  

 Westinghouse is an employer that treats everyone equally.
   

  

**Some of the benefits employees in the Sweden can expect:**
* Wellness Allowance
* Flexible pay opportunities via our Benefit portal
* Work hour reduction (ATF) and occupational pension (ITP)
* ASB Insurance: compensation for the cost of health care, dental care hearing aids, glasses and more
* Employee Assistance Program: confidential counseling and resources for employees, eligible dependents, and household members
* Employee Referral Program: potential for employees to earn a monetary award for referring other qualified candidates to Westinghouse


**Get connected with Westinghouse on social media:** 
**Twitter** 
**|** 
**Facebook** 
**|** 
**LinkedIn** 
**|** 
**YouTube**

title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 In this role, you will act as the owner of, and set the strategy and roadmap for Data Analytics within HR in Sweden, with a strong focus on People Analytics and Data Management. The role combines strategic ownership with operational leadership. You will work in close cooperation with architects and expert users as well as key stakeholders such as Payroll, HR Business Partners and HR Management.
   

  

 Further, you will act as sub-project manager/stream lead within Project Phoenix - a central project to decommission the local legacy HRIS and align all affected capabilities, processes and integrations with the global HR strategy & setup, following an "As global as possible, as local as necessary" approach.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Define and own the People Data Analytics strategy and roadmap for HR in Sweden, aligned with the global People Data direction for Scania.
* Ensure high data quality, governance, GDPR compliance, and security for HR data together with other People Data Analysts in the organization.
* Own HR data architecture for Sweden, such as data models, and data flows from global and local systems to analytics platforms, including Snowflake and reporting tools.
* Act as stream lead and operational sub-project manager for the data stream within Project Phoenix, including direction for reporting and data management aligned with new solutions and system decommissioning. You will be leading the data stream and ensure correct HR data and reports during decommissioning and the transition to new systems and updated processes.
* Replace legacy HR system reporting and Excel-based processes with automated, auditable, and self-service analytics solutions.
* Enable and develop a strong People Analytics capability, providing insights, recommendations, and decision support to People & Culture management and senior stakeholders.


 Who You Are
   

  

 You have extensive experience in data, analytics, or BI roles, preferably within HR, People Analytics.
   

  

 You combine a strategic mindset with hands-on capability, and are comfortable owning both long-term direction and operational delivery.
   

  

 You are strong in stakeholder management and can communicate complex data topics clearly to senior leaders and non-technical audiences.
   

  

 You have experience in data management, data architecture, and analytics platforms (e.g. SQL, Snowflake, Power BI) and can communicate technical data matters with developers and architects at Scania IT.
   

  

 You thrive in complex transformation environments and are confident working across local and global organizations. You have strong verbal and written communication skills in both Swedish and English.
   

  

 This Is Us
   

  

 You will join the HR Systems Sweden organization, working closely with other departments within People & Culture and Scania IT, as well as global Data & Analytics teams. We are in the middle of a major transformation where HR data, analytics, and system landscapes are being reshaped through Project Phoenix. As your manager, I value clarity, trust, collaboration, and continuous development, and I aim to create an environment where expertise is encouraged, perspectives are respected, and we succeed together through shared ownership.
   

  

 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-02-04. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Jetta Lundin, Group Manager, jetta.lundin@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior Vice President, Group Country Manager, Nordics & Baltics
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments technology, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories, dedicated to uplifting everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 At Visa, you'll have the opportunity to create impact at scale — tackling meaningful challenges, growing your skills and seeing your contributions impact lives around the world. Join Visa and do work that matters — to you, to your community, and to the world.
   

  





 Progress starts with you.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**Role Overview**




 The Group Country Manager (GCM) will have end to end leadership accountability for the growth of Visa’s business across the Nordics and Baltics cluster. The GCM will lead a cross-functional leadership team to identify and drive market initiatives and strategies within the cluster that aid Visa Europe’s accelerated growth. The role will report to the Regional President of the Visa Europe Region.
   

  





 The Nordics & Baltics cluster comprises 8 markets – Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Iceland, Finland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania - all at different stages of digital payments adoption. This leader will lead a diverse, multi-market team that tailors Visa’s global strategy to the region’s unique political, regulatory, and commercial context.
   

  





 The role will drive engagement with all stakeholders within Visa’s ecosystem, bringing commercial judgement, influence, and rigor to grow Visa’s position in the cluster, while also leading on some pan-European initiatives. The GCM will operate at C-Suite level with clients and lead key strategic market and technology developments. This role requires a strong results focus and growth mindset, setting clear outcomes and relentlessly executing to exceed ambitious commercial and client-impact goals. Operate with high energy and speed, mobilising cross‑functional teams to remove roadblocks and accelerate delivery. Be deeply client-centric, co-creating solutions, champion market leading innovation, and deliver measurable value.
   

  





 The successful individual will be an authentic, inspiring, and courageous leader, unwavering in their passion to drive growth and harness the capabilities and assets at Visa - the brand, our products, and our people.
   

  





  

  





**Key Responsibilities**



* Work closely with the Europe Regional President and the Europe Leadership Team to shape and execute the wider regional strategy, driving significant growth to reach aspirations of 2030 strategy.
* Design and execute the strategic growth plan for the cluster as part of the broader Europe growth strategy.
* Lead the business to deliver ambitious growth and continued financial performance.
* Influence at a senior level with all clients as a trusted advisor and true partner- a thought leader who is curious and understands our clients’ business, growth goals, challenges, and strategic objectives.
* Expand and utilize a network at the most senior level within key client organizations and the market, seeking common opportunities for growth.
* Provide inspirational leadership to the cluster by continuing to build, develop and lead a high performing and diverse team. Be a talent ambassador by driving talent development in the region and sponsoring Visa’s employer brand activity in the Nordics & Baltics cluster and broader Europe market.
* Represent Visa externally on a regular basis through interactions with key clients, the press, domestic regulators, government agencies, consumers, merchants and the broader fintech - emerging digital ecosystem.
