title: Cloud Posture Engineer (Azure) till Handelsbanken
description:
Vi söker en Cloud Posture Engineer (Azure) som vill bidra till att stärka Handelsbankens arbete med säkerhet, compliance och styrning i molnet.
   

  

 Ditt team
   

  

 Som Cloud Posture Engineer (Azure) kommer du att ingå i Cloud Foundation-teamet, ett tvärfunktionellt team inom Handelsbanken. Här arbetar molnarkitekter, säkerhetsingenjörer, utvecklare och specialister tillsammans med funktioner inom compliance och support för att utveckla bankens molnlösningar enligt högt ställda säkerhets- och regulatoriska krav.
   

  

 Området består av cirka 30 medarbetare och ett tiotal konsulter, fördelat på två agila team och stöttande funktioner. I Cloud Foundation-teamet, där du blir en viktig del, arbetar vi nära bankens säkerhets- och infrastrukturteam samt andra verksamhetsområden.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I rollen som Cloud Posture Engineer (Azure) ansvarar du för att designa, implementera och förvalta tekniska regelverk och relaterade governance-komponenter. Du ansvarar för att översätta säkerhetskrav och regelverk till effektiva skydd i Azure, samtidigt som du möjliggör en kostnadseffektiv och säker användning av Azure i hela banken.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Automatisera hantering av efterlevnad och säkerhet i Azure med hjälp av verktyg som Git, CI/CD Pipelines, Azure Policy och Defender for Cloud.
* Designa, implementera och övervaka Azure Policies för att minska risker och optimera resurser.
* Samarbeta med säkerhets-, plattforms- och utvecklingsteam för att definiera och driva molnstandarder.
* Analysera efterlevnad/compliance och föreslå förbättringar för ökad säkerhet och riskminimering
* Stötta och utbilda andra team i bästa praxis för molnpolicy och governance.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Djupa kunskaper i Azure Governance, särskilt Azure Policy, Azure Resource Manager och Azure Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF).
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (IaC) – t.ex. Terraform, Bicep eller ARM Templates.
* Förståelse och stort intresse för säkerhet och compliance i molnmiljöer.
* Scriptingkunskaper i PowerShell, Azure CLI eller Python.
* Förståelse för RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) och övervakning via Azure Monitor/Log Analytics.
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet med Azure Policy.


 Som person är du analytisk, lösningsorienterad och har en stark känsla för säkerhet och kvalitet. Du trivs i team men arbetar lika gärna självständigt och är van vid att arbeta i en agil miljö.
   

  

 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har relevanta certifieringar inom Azure Governance eller Security.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Som ett steg i Handelsbankens rekryteringsprocess krävs en godkänd bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat, utförd av en extern part, innan anställning kan ske.*
**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Nabila Yalcin, nabila.yalcin@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**TA Partner:** 
 Robert Weineland, robert.weineland@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:** 
 Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se

title: Machine Learning engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Machine Learning Engineer at Viaplay, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the next generation of our data-driven products and services. Working at the intersection of personalization, customer engagement, and operational intelligence, you’ll design and deploy state-of-the-art ML systems that directly impact millions of users across our platform.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will extend far beyond model development. You’ll act as a strategic partner to product, engineering, and commercial teams, translating business objectives into scalable, high-impact ML solutions. Whether enhancing our recommendation engines, uncovering deep user insights, or enabling smarter decision-making across the organization, your work will be central to Viaplay’s continued growth and innovation.
   

  

 You’ll join a high-performing, inclusive, and curious team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Analysts, and Data Engineers. Together, we foster a culture of experimentation, shared ownership, and technical excellence. Our recommender system already powers engaging user experiences, and we’re only at the beginning of our machine learning journey.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models for recommendation, prediction, and classification use cases.
* Own and lead end-to-end ML initiatives, from ideation and stakeholder alignment to development, deployment, and ongoing performance evaluation.
* Translate business needs into structured ML problems and deliver measurable, impactful outcomes.
* Build robust, production-ready pipelines and monitor ML systems in a cloud-native environment.
* Conduct advanced statistical analyses to uncover trends in user behavior, content performance, and platform engagement.
* Collaborate closely with product, engineering, content, commercial, and marketing teams to drive data-informed decision-making.
* Contribute to a culture of experimentation, innovation, and continuous learning within the data team.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We're seeking someone who combines technical depth with strategic thinking and a curious, problem-solving mindset.
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Proven experience leading ML projects end-to-end, from problem definition and stakeholder alignment to deployment and monitoring in production.
* Expertise in one or more ML domains such as LLMs, NLP, recommendation systems, or reinforcement learning.
* Ability to build ML solutions that are scalable, robust, and explainable, not just performant in isolation.
* Strong experience deploying ML models in cloud environments (preferably AWS) and using containerization tools like Docker .
* Familiarity with orchestration tools such as Airflow for reliable ML pipeline execution and monitoring
* Solid software engineering fundamentals.
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in applied Machine Learning within production environments.
* Strong academic background in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with recommender systems, personalization, or content optimization — ideally in media, streaming, or e-commerce.
* Familiarity with MLOps practices, including CI/CD for ML, model monitoring, and production observability.
* Exposure to real-time or near-real-time ML architectures and streaming data systems.


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with at least three days a week in the office, giving you the best mix of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Head of Customer Interactions
description:
Are you our new Head of Customer Interactions in market Sweden?
 



  





**As a market-leading credit management company, Intrum has a broad competence in debt collection services and we do business in 20 countries in Europe. We have more than 10,000 experienced employees in our group.** 




 Our business is about helping others. Helping indebted individuals to get out of difficult situations. Helping businesses get paid so they can grow, hire and prosper. Which in turn is positive for the entire economy. You become an essential part of this circle with us, which gives your job at Intrum a deeper meaning. Regardless of your role or title
 **.** 




**Being at the forefront is everyone's job.** 
 As the market leader, it is up to us to be at the forefront. Shaping the industry. Setting new standards. And wherever in the world your Intrum career path takes you, whatever role you play, you will contribute to growth, innovation and impact that makes a real difference.
 




**To have the opportunity to grow.** 
 In our organization there are many opportunities to advance, specialize and rotate. Or even try your wings abroad. It's up to you to make it happen. The fact that our business is about helping others – individuals and companies, means that your work also develops on a more personal level. Simply put, you will grow by making a difference.
 



**The role** 




**The role will report to Transformation Director Sweden** 




**Location for this position is** 
 Stockholm (Sickla)
 




 Hybrid work. We see that hybrid work, where we as employees can work either from home or from the office, creates opportunities to perform and work effectively in virtual and real environments.
 



  





**Purpose of role** 




 As Head of Customer Interactions, you lead the CoE and own the end‑to‑end channel strategy and service model and the business development of the customer journey. The emphasis is on customer understanding, communication & interaction logic, segmentation and Next‑Best‑Action (NBA). You set direction and prioritise capabilities, while the PO, Genesys Cloud is responsible for technical delivery (configuration, release, run). You hold line management for Genesys/omnichannel engineers and Business Analysts.
 



  





**Responsibilities of role** 




  




* Own and evolve the channel strategy & service model (voice/IVR, chat, email, messaging, portal/self‑service, Virtual Assistants) with targets for FCR, AHT/ACW, queue/wait, digital containment, CSAT/NPS.
* Lead the business development of Proactive & Intelligence‑Driven CRM (segmentation, Customer‑360, propensity models, NBA and real‑time channel orchestration).
* Ensure customer insight & journey design (qual/quant research, experimentation/AB tests, content & dialogue design) that guides technical development (by the PO, Genesys Cloud).
* Prioritise value streams/backlogs (WSJF/ROI), define MVP→scale, own benefits, budget/funding and before/after measurement.
* Line management: recruit, coach and develop engineers and analysts; plan capacity and ensure PI/sprint delivery discipline.
* Govern compliance (DPIA, data protection, QA, recording/archiving) and measurement (standard KPIs, leadership reporting).
* Partner with Data & AI CoE (intent, routing, sentiment, conversational/GenAI), Automation CoE (RPA/IDP/orchestration) and Tech Enablement (integration/API, identity/SSO).
* Leading change and/or transformational activities and creating followship and influencing others



  





**Your Background** 



* 7–10+ years in contact centre/omnichannel/CRM, several in leadership with benefits/value responsibility.
* Proven record in channel strategy, service model, journey optimisation and business development.
* Strong grasp of Genesys Cloud (or equivalent) from a capability/business perspective; technical delivery sits with the PO, Genesys Cloud.
* Comfortable with segmentation, Customer‑360, NBA and value tracking (FCR, AHT/ACW, CSAT/NPS).
* Agile/SAFe, portfolio/backlog governance, benefits tracking and outstanding stakeholder leadership.
* Nice to have: GenAI/conversational AI & agent assist, identity (2FA/BankID), Azure‑aligned data platforms.



  





**Who are you** 




 A customer‑ and value‑oriented leader who blends strategy with execution. You set direction, prioritise decisively and create clarity—letting customer insight and ROI steer capability development.
 



**You act according to our values. Our values are not words. They are everything.** 




 Behind our global expansion and major digital transformation are four simple but powerful values. Ethics. Devotion. Solutions. Empathy. It is the values that drive our everyday life, regardless of how big we become. Others may think they are small things. But for us, they are everything.
 



**Are you curious or have questions?** 




 You are welcome to contact the recruitment manager for more information: Nima Ghorbani.
 



 Only applications received through our online system will be considered.

title: External Communications Lead (Europe)
description:
**TL;DR —** 
 We're looking for a strategic, hands-on external communications lead to drive Lovable's European media relations, public affairs engagements, and employer brand. You'll shape how Lovable shows up in Sweden and across Europe — from media relations to policy engagement to talent attraction — while helping establish our voice as a global leader in democratizing software creation. This is a high-growth, high-impact role based in our Stockholm headquarters.
   

  

***Relocation assistance may be offered.***
**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products — fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people worldwide already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we're just getting started.
   

  

 We're a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* External comms experience in hypergrowth tech: 5+ years building and executing external communications at fast-growing technology companies (B2B or B2C SaaS preferred), ideally with experience building new programs while staying hands-on
* Public affairs and policy fluency: Experience engaging with policymakers, government stakeholders, or multilateral organizations (e.g., WEF, EU institutions); comfort positioning executives in AI policy conversations
* European communications expertise: Strong relationships with European tech and business media (including new media), with a track record of securing meaningful, on-message coverage; experience with issues management a plus
* Executive partnership and preparation: Track record of advising and coaching spokespeople for media interviews, speaking engagements, and high-profile public moments
* Employer brand instincts: Understanding of how external communications drives talent attraction; bonus points for direct experience developing narratives that resonate with technical audiences
* Extreme ownership with keen attention to detail: You take full accountability for outcomes, sweat the small stuff, and catch what others miss
* Comfort with ambiguity and speed: You're energized (not drained) by fast-moving environments where priorities shift and you're building the plane while flying it


**What You'll Do**
* Own European media relations: Develop and execute Lovable's European media strategy — journalist relationships, proactive pitching, and reactive opportunities
* Support public affairs and policy engagement: Help position Lovable and our executives in AI policy conversations, supporting presence at forums like Davos, government engagements, and thought leadership on democratizing software creation
* Lead employer brand for talent attraction: Drive external communications that reinforce Lovable as a destination for world-class talent, particularly technical hires in Europe — from content strategy to media placement to awards
* Develop and support executive spokespeople: Prepare executives for European media opportunities and speaking engagements, including message development, media training, and briefings
* Manage our European events presence: Identify and execute strategic speaking opportunities and events that advance Lovable's visibility and credibility with European audiences
* Shape our communications foundations: As an early member of the comms team, help establish the frameworks, processes, and ways of working that will scale with Lovable's growth

title: Senior Enterprise Architect
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Vivicta, former Tietoevry Tech Services, now operates as a standalone company under our new brand. We’ve officially launched Vivicta, your trusted Nordic transformation partner, making everyday easier through technology. You can explore more about our brand and what we stand for at https://www.vivicta.com
   

  

 Ready to join us? Click ‘Apply’ and complete our short application form to get started. Prefer another option? Apply via LinkedIn to automatically populate your details using your profile.
   

  

 Vill du ta en ledande roll i att forma framtidens IT-arkitektur för några av Sveriges mest framstående företag? Är du redo att ta ansvar för strategiska beslut och vägleda både kunder och interna team mot innovativa, hållbara lösningar?
   

  

 Vi söker en senior Enterprise arkitekt till vårt arkitektteam inom Data, Cloud och Security (DCS) i Sverige. Hos oss blir du en nyckelperson som inte bara översätter affärsbehov till tekniska strategier, utan också driver arkitekturvisioner och säkerställer att våra lösningar skapar långsiktigt värde.
   

  

**När du blir en del av Vivicta som Senior Enterprise Architect:**
* Kommer du agera strategisk rådgivare för våra kunder och interna team, med fokus på att definiera och implementera Enterprise-arkitektur som stödjer affärsmål och digital transformation.
* Leda arkitekturinitiativ från idé till genomförande, inklusive styrning av roadmap, standarder och riktlinjer.
* Organisera workshops och strategiska möten med ledningsgrupper för att identifiera teknologiska möjligheter och risker.
* Utveckla och kommunicera arkitekturprinciper som säkerställer skalbarhet, säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet.
* Driva integration av avancerad dataanalys och AI som en strategisk komponent i kundernas verksamhet.
* Säkerställa att lösningar följer bästa praxis för styrning, compliance och hållbara IT-investeringar.
* Agera mentor/coach för juniora arkitekter och bidra till kompetensutveckling inom teamet.


*Resor kan förekomma i tjänsten, främst inom Sverige.*
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Du har djup erfarenhet av komplexa IT-landskap och affärsprocesser inom tillverkningsindustrin eller försvarssektorn, och är van att agera rådgivare på högsta nivå.
* Mycket god dokumenterad erfarenhet av Enterprise-arkitektur, med dokumenterad framgång i att leda komplexa IT-transformationer.
* Djup erfarenhet inom minst ett av följande segment: Finans, Bank & Försäkring Industri & Handel, Offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram strategiska analyser och rekommendationer samt förankra dessa med ledare och beslutsfattare på olika nivåer inom organisationen.
* Expertis inom dataarkitektur, molnplattformar och integration av AI i verksamhetssystem.
* Stark teknisk kompetens inom affärssystem, samt moderna arkitekturmönster (API-first, mikrotjänster, masterdatahantering).
* Djup kompetens inom moderniserings- och transformationsstrategier samt etablerade ramverk för att stödja komplexa förändringsinitiativ.
* Utmärkt förmåga att skapa tydliga och visuellt tilltalande presentationer som omvandlar komplexa frågeställningar till ett enkelt och begripligt format, anpassat för flera olika intressenter.
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och ledarskapsförmågor, med förmåga att inspirera och driva förändring.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Vi erbjuder professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, en öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Hos oss får du möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en nyckel till din framgång. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vårt sätt att arbeta. Dessutom tror vi på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil – där du utvecklas varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Blev du inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer hålls löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Har du frågor om rollen? Kontakta anställande chef Dilek Konduk på dilek.konduk@vivicta.com.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Vivicta tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*

title: Client Executive till Walley!
description:
***Walley strävar efter att vara det självklara valet för stora e-handlare och retailbolag i Norden och vi vill ha fler talangfulla personer med oss på vår resa.
   

  

 Vi vet att rätt betallösning är en avgörande faktor för handlares framgång.
   

  

 Därför söker vi en Client Executive som är mer än bara en closer – någon som kan utmana kundernas perspektiv och erbjuda betalningslösningar som ger verkligt värde. Om du är redo att bygga djupa relationer med Nordens främsta e-handlare och hjälpa dem att omdefiniera sina betalflöden, vill vi gärna höra från dig!***
**OM ROLLEN**
 I rollen som Client Executive kommer du att bygga och utveckla nya partnerskap med ledande aktörer inom e-handel och retail. Du ansvarar för att skapa förtroende och visa på det affärsvärde våra lösningar ger, och fungerar som en strategisk rådgivare som hjälper kunder att förstå betalningens roll i deras framgång. För att lyckas arbetar du nära både marknads- och produktteam och säkerställer att varje kundmöte anpassas efter deras behov och utmaningar.
   

  

**OM DIG**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av komplex B2B-försäljning, med minst 3 års erfarenhet inom betallösningar.
* Etablerat affärsnätverk inom retail och e-handel är mycket meriterande.
* Förmåga att kommunicera på ett framstående sätt och fungera som strategisk rådgivare för kunder.
* Du trivs med att utmana och vägleda kunder genom insiktsdriven försäljning.


 Redo att hjälpa kunder förbättra sina betalprocesser? Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team!
   

  

**AFFÄRSOMRÅDET WALLEY**
 Walley utvecklar lösningar som gör betalningar smartare, enklare och tryggare för både handlare och slutkunder. Walley erbjuder dels den tekniska checkoutlösningen när kunden har tagit sin varukorg vidare för betalning, dels kreditlösningar (faktura, delbetalning m.m.). Walley fokuserar på större handlare i Norden, även med verksamhet i andra länder och inom en bredd av branscher.
   

  

**OM NORION BANK GROUP**
 Norion Bank Group är en affärsnära nordisk finansieringsbank. Genom koncernens varumärken Norion Bank, Walley och Collector erbjuds kundanpassade finansieringstjänster som möter distinkta kundbehov inom tre kundsegment: medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag, handlare och privatpersoner. Som specialist på finansieringslösningar är Norion Bank Group ett ledande komplement till traditionella storbanker, med visionen att vara den främsta nordiska finansieringsbanken inom de utvalda segmenten.
   

  

 Norion Banks erbjudande omfattar företags- och fastighetskrediter samt factoring för medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag. Genom varumärket Walley erbjuds flexibla betal- och checkoutlösningar till handlare och privatpersoner. Varumärket Collector tillhandahåller privatlån och kreditkort till privatpersoner samt sparkonton för privatpersoner och företag. Norion Bank Group (tidigare Collector Bank) grundades 1999 och har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Oslo och Helsingfors. Verksamheten bedrivs genom Norion Bank AB (publ) som är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm.
   

  

**NORION BANKS ERBJUDANDE TILL DIG**
 För oss är det självklart att varje individs utveckling värdesätts högt vilket innebär ett stort fokus på självledarskap och kompetensutveckling. Gemenskap, innovation och modern arbetsmetodik är saker som kännetecknar Norion Bank Group. Vi erbjuder dig helt enkelt en organisation med snabba beslutsvägar, stor öppenhet och mycket energi.
   

  

 Våra värdeord Affärsmässighet, Engagemang och Omtanke genomsyrar allt vi gör och som medarbetare hos oss blir du en del av vår starka företagskultur. Vi erbjuder dig ett spännande bolag med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, löpande kompetensutveckling och gemensamma aktiviteter på och utanför arbetsplatsen.
   

  

**FÖRDOMSFRI REKRYTERING**
 Vi vill att vår rekryteringsprocess ska vara rättvis och inkluderande. Därför ber vi dig att inte bifoga foto eller annan information som inte är relevant för tjänsten. Personligt brev är inget krav.
   

  

**Vi undanber oss kontakt med rekry** 
**teringsbolag, konsultbolag samt
 **annonsörer** 
 i rekryteringen.**
**INTRESSERAD?**
 Kul! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så ansök redan idag!
   

  

 Norion Bank Group är en affärsnära nordisk finansieringsbank. Genom koncernens varumärken Norion Bank, Walley och Collector erbjuds kundanpassade finansieringstjänster som möter distinkta kundbehov inom tre kundsegment: medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag, handlare och privatpersoner. Som specialist på finansieringslösningar är Norion Bank Group ett ledande komplement till traditionella storbanker, med visionen att vara den främsta nordiska finansieringsbanken inom de utvalda segmenten.
   

  

  

  

 Norion Banks erbjudande omfattar företags- och fastighetskrediter samt factoring för medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag. Genom varumärket Walley erbjuds flexibla betal- och checkoutlösningar till handlare och privatpersoner. Varumärket Collector tillhandahåller privatlån och kreditkort till privatpersoner samt sparkonton för privatpersoner och företag. Norion Bank (tidigare Collector Bank) grundades 1999 och har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Oslo och Helsingfors. Verksamheten bedrivs genom Norion Bank AB (publ) som är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Senior Frontend Developer (Angular)**
 Location: Stockholm, Sweden or Krakow, Poland
   

  

 Hybrid │ Digital & Access Solutions
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will join a team developing applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Frontend Developer** 
 , you’ll
 **architect and build Angular web applications** 
 and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver features that users rely on every day.
   

  

 This
 **senior role** 
 offers the opportunity to
 **expand into cloud-based backend development** 
 while keeping your focus on delivering
 **high-quality frontend experiences** 
 .
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Lead Frontend Development**
* Architect frontend web applications with Angular.
* Develop and maintain web frontend applications with high performance, usability, and responsiveness.
* Collaborate with product, UX, and engineering teams to define, design, and release new features. Collaborate with QA to develop our automation test suite.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


**Grow into Full-Stack & Cloud (Nice-to-Have)**
* Integrate frontend applications with RESTful APIs.
* Explore cloud-native solutions with AWS Lambda and other serverless services.
* Gain experience with Go backend development, contributing to backend architecture discussions and CI/CD improvements.
* Work with python-based integration tests.


**What You Bring**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Expert in Angular development (at least 3 years professional Angular experience) with strong understanding of architecture, performance, and scalability.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills .
* Nice-to-have/desire to learn: experience integrating with RESTful APIs, cloud services (AWS), backend development in Go (Golang) and Python.


**What You Gain By Joining ASSA ABLOY**
**Work That Makes a Difference**
 Your work helps create a safer, more open world. The Angular applications you build are part of digital access solutions used every day in homes, workplaces, hospitals, and public buildings worldwide.
   

  

**Ownership & Trust**
 As a senior engineer, you’ll take ownership of frontend architecture and technical decisions. You’ll be trusted to shape high-quality Angular solutions and collaborate closely with product, UX, and engineering teams to deliver real value.
   

  

**Growth with Modern Technologies**
 You’ll deepen your Angular expertise while having the opportunity to grow into full-stack and cloud development using Go (Golang) and AWS, supported by continuous learning and real-world challenges.
   

  

**A Collaborative Culture**
 You’ll join a collaborative, international team built on trust, openness, and respect for work–life balance. Your experience is valued, your voice is heard, and your contribution matters.
   

  

**Ready to Build Software That Protects the World?**
 If you want to work with Angular at the core, contribute across frontend and backend, and build cloud software that people genuinely depend on, we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 Apply today. Bring your expertise. Shape the digital future of secure access.
   

  

 We review applications regularly, so don't wait.
   

  

 We’re committed to building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves thriving here.
   

  

 To protect your personal data, we don’t review applications sent by email or post. Questions? Contact Léa Rein, Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at lea.rein@assaabloy.com
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Stories have the power to make the ordinary extraordinary. They help us think bigger, see beyond ourselves, and deepen our connection with others.
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading audiobook and e-book streaming platforms, Storytel brings unlimited listening to millions of users across 25+ markets. Driven by our purpose - “Leading the future of storytelling, we move the world through stories” - Storytel Group inspires and entertains people around the world by blending innovation with tradition. We bring stories to life across various formats for everyone to discover. Anytime. Anywhere.
   

  

**Ready for your next chapter? We’re looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our Machine Learning Team, in Sweden or Denmark!**
**About The Team**
 The Machine Learning team at Storytel is a seasoned group operating within the Experience Domain. This domain is dedicated to enhancing the user experience across mobile platforms, with a focus on key areas such as personalized content discovery and creating an immersive listening experience.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join Storytel's Machine Learning team as a Data Scientist and drive impact across key areas like customer engagement, automated content curation, and personalized recommendations. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and deploying models that significantly enhance the user experience, deepening their connection to stories globally. Your data-driven insights will be crucial in shaping our retention strategies and optimizing our platform experience and performance.
   

  

**As a Machine Learning Engineer At Storytel, You Will**
* Be part of a cross-functional environment, working together with highly talented colleagues across Product & Engineering, Content, Marketing, and Business Analytics, influencing decision-making throughout the organization.
* Collaborate closely with Engineers, UX Designers, Content Curators, and Product Managers to solve problems and explore opportunities end-to-end, driving impact with a short feedback loop.
* Partner closely with the ML and Data Engineers to ensure smooth deployment, scalability and robustness of machine learning systems.
* Design experiments, measure model performance, and shape data-driven strategies to enhance customer engagement.
* Leverage your data science competence to support reliable and effective integration of Generative AI technologies into the product experience.
* Engage in the ML community meetings, journal clubs, and peer learning activities to stay at the forefront of industry trends, share insights, and strengthen the team’s collective expertise.
* Shape the future, as part of a mission-driven team that directly influences how people connect with stories worldwide.


**About You**
 To thrive in this role, we believe that you are a passionate individual who is knowledgeable in information retrieval models and AI technologies. You are an independent thinker who can collaborate effectively with diverse teams and communicate complex ideas clearly. Additionally, you are proactive in educating stakeholders about the value of data-driven solutions and are collaborative by nature.
   

  

**You Also Have The Following Experience**
* An advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields.
* 5+ years of professional experience in data science or machine learning roles.
* Significant breadth and depth of statistics/ML knowledge.
* Proficiency in Python and SQL, and coding best practices.
* Solid experience with developing scalable and reliable ML systems that serve thousands to millions of users.
* Experience presenting your work to non-technical stakeholders, translating complex ideas into actionable insights.


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Hands-on experience with recommender systems.
* Familiarity with cloud-native technologies and/or the Google Cloud Platform.
* Experience with model deployment and a solid understanding of MLOps best practices.
* Strong knowledge of model evaluation techniques.


 Join a world of stories
   

  

 At Storytel, we’re a team of creative story lovers who thrive on collaboration and new ideas. Our workplace is friendly, dynamic, and full of opportunities to experiment and make an impact. We believe in trust, flat hierarchies, and empowering you to grow with us.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be located in Stockholm, Sweden or Copenhagen, Denmark. We also welcome fully remote candidates within Sweden and Denmark.
   

  

 Does this sound like your next story? Simply fill out the application form and share your CV or LinkedIn profile – no cover letter needed. Answer a few questions, and you’re all set.

title: Data Scientist (Knowledge Graph)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 550 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Knowledge graph consultant, you will help our clients make better data-driven decisions by modeling and building robust data flows, creating an efficient data transporter, and building data architecture for Machine Learning solutions and BI solutions. You will also work with the development of computer science solutions stars on graph technology.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Assisting our clients in their work, as they exploit the capabilities of the W3C Semantic Stack (RDF, RDFS, SPARQL, OWL, SHACL), graph databases and ontology modelling tools, or tech stack like Neo4j, Cypher or Labeled Property Graph implementations.
* Combining knowledge graphs with Natural Language Processing – a perfect opportunity for someone with a background as linguist combined with a great interest in knowledge graphs.
* Working with a variation of clients located across Northern Europe. In a hybrid working model, you might be asked to travel while on other occasions you will be working remotely.
* Bringing success in the role, by thriving in an international environment, where you generously share your domain knowledge within Graph technology.


**Your profile**
* You have worked in the public or private sector, where you have used your domain experience in knowledge graph technologies. You enjoy solving complex modeling problems
* Knowledge about Linked Data Concepts
* ETL processes with various graph databases and experience in Interaction with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages
* Information and Data Management
* Programming skills (specific language is not required, but we use Python, Java or .Net)
* Semantic technologies: Utilize (W3C) Standards of the Semantic Stack. Knowledge regarding several databases (or excellent on at least one) and modelling knowledge with ontologies using various tools.
* Skills for LPG: Knowledge regarding several databases or excellent on at least one.
* You live in Stockholm Greater area of Sweden.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We work closely with Neo4J on both a local and European level.


**Application**
 Welcome to apply!
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Database Delivery Consultant , ProServe EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Strong database experience
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Swedish language is required


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS,


 Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
   

  

* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
